column1: This is pure cruelty. It’s clear POTUS’ brush with #COVID has taught him nothing. Millions are struggling and with COVID only speeding up and Flu season right around the corner the Admin refusing to deal means there will be nothing to help Americans through. https://t.co/wVzN9ySdKN

The recent #COVID outbreak at the White House proves that the virus doesn’t discriminate. Those who refuse to wear masks socially distance and wash their hands are especially at risk. Be safe be smart. https://t.co/VtKuBrsr50
Republicans are blocking crucial bills in the Senate that would raise minimum wage and provide further relief to businesses and individuals sidelined by #COVID. Democrats are fighting #ForThePeople.

#COVID19 has brought to the forefront the inequities women of color face in health care even when they are pregnant. I'm fighting to pass my bill the Maternal Health Quality Improvement Act which will help close these gaps. https://t.co/EjmrAt9zDb
Hey @SenTedCruz pass the #COVID relief package so these blue collar workers you‘re claiming to care about can eat and pay rent this month. https://t.co/1bn0sibg1i

It is unbelievable that during a crisis the @SenateGOP would reduce #unemploymentbenefits. Americans are suffering @senatemajldr they have been laid off as a direct result of #COVID their jobs don't exist while parts of the Country remain closed. We cannot abandon Americans. https://t.co/Qun10AAUl4

The current national trend of #COVID infection is unsustainable. The #science points to the danger of this pandemic for all ages. If we are to open schools in the fall we must act NOW with a national mask wearing strategy to stop the spread. https://t.co/WlwmIFYAit

It’s now been 62 days since the House sent the #heroesact to @senatemajldr after a bipartisan vote. Americans need that relief and more in order to battle the #COVID pandemic. Delaying the vote is hurting Americans.

Tens of millions Americans are out of work and @realdonaldtrump wants to take away their healthcare. If #SCOTUS allows Trump to reinstate his horrendous Medicaid work requirements it would eliminate coverage for millions during a pandemic. #COVID https://t.co/tHJc8k91mI

Instead of supporting #American families the #Trump Admin once again wants to pull the plug on programs that help families practice good public health habits like social distancing. The #HeroesAct would improve benefits for Americans during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/kz21C8TuJp

While #COVID19 is still raging across the US many Americans are being crushed by debt and rent. @senatemajldr is sitting on the #HEROESACT which would provide financial relief for ppl & would strengthen unemployment. #Americans need more support now.

Today I joined Rep. Higgins in leading Members of the #NY delegation on a letter to CMS urging it to approve changes to strengthen NY’s health care system and provide $2.75 Billion to help fight #COVID19. https://t.co/luVFNDtTTU

I don’t believe @realDonaldTrump was joking when he said he’d prefer there be less tests for #COVID19. Everything @POTUS does demonstrates how ineffectual his presidency is at mitigating crises. Luckily there were enough empty seats that his words weren’t heard by many. https://t.co/0lYGbMxakx

Today is #WorldBloodDay and donating is especially important now more than ever while we fight #COVID19. Your donation could make a lifesaving difference. Find a donation site here: https://t.co/wa3QKZxxFS

Contact tracing and testing are critical to safely re-opening #NYC. I helped secure $807M for the City's efforts and as Chair of Foreign Affairs I helped cut through red-tape to get 100k antibody tests to the City. #COVID19 https://t.co/CQ34AZLm0I

Bad actors are trying to use #COVID19 to sell NYers fake tests and products. To fight this criminal activity the House recently passed my Safeguarding Therapeutics Act which enables the FDA to destroy fake medical devices like fake #Coronavirus tests.  https://t.co/Q2a9RHvnHY

COVID-19 has reduced access to critical maternal and child health programs particularly in low income and minority communities. Recently I co-led 77 Members of the House urging a funding increase for these programs. https://t.co/QtKyt97rhN

This #MemorialDay as always I am humbled by the weight of our service members’ sacrifice. Thank you to all who have served to those that mourn the Gold Star families and those still serving on the frontlines abroad or domestically fighting #COVID19. We will never forget.

We are in dire need of the #HeroesAct. @senatemajldr is withholding a vote because @HouseDems won’t give more money to billionaires + corporations. We must protect our citizens who are unemployed whose rent is due and who are sick or fighting #COVID19. https://t.co/VEfcdigjpl

To provide additional funding today I led over 150 Members on a letter to @SecAzar urging funding for community health centers like @MVHNC_Inc & @HRHCare in NY-16 which have bravely served low-income and vulnerable communities during COVID-19. #ValueCHCs #FundCHCs https://t.co/Hx7C6pPats

NY community health centers are on the frontlines of fighting COVID-19 in NY-16. To support them I have led the NY Delegation in securing $76M from the CARES Act and another $40M for testing. #FundCHCs #ValueCHCs #SaveCHCs https://t.co/9OchOOzIv6

Additionally the HEROES Act includes several provisions I advocated for to help NY: ✅2.5% bump in Medicaid DSH payments ✅My “Safeguarding Therapeutics Act” which allows the FDA to destroy fake medical devices including fake COVID19 tests ✅$5B for NY public education system
At today’s hearing I asked what more can the federal government do to protect Americans during the COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/iXRa7wR2T2

As Chair of @HouseForeign it is clear to me that #COVID19 has exposed the US’ over-reliance on foreign suppliers for critical medical products leading to shortages during this crisis. The CARES Act included my bill to help prevent shortages of medications in the US.

I asked Dr. Bright about the timeline for a vaccine & the Trump Admin’s dismissal of scientific research which has cost us lives. It’s clear that Dr. Bright was pushing scientific-based solutions for the COVID19 response & the White House wouldn’t have it https://t.co/i12PrVGm8P

Dr. Bright an expert official who was leading the charge in fighting #COVID19 has come forward with dire news of mismanagement by @POTUS while over 84k Americans have died. To my @HouseGOP colleagues we need answers now. https://t.co/BpsBTGecjP

On April 24 I helped enact legislation to increase coronavirus testing in NY. Today this program is providing NY state with $700M and NYC with $807M to expand testing capacity. I will continue to fight to get federal $ to NY to help end this outbreak.

I’ve pushed the Trump Administration to prioritize funding for NY community health centers. Recently NY health centers were awarded nearly $40M to increase coronavirus testing the 2nd largest amount in the US of which $5M was awarded to #NY16. https://t.co/Ngq19FtUsw

CARES Act provided NY hospitals with advance Medicare payments to help fight COVID19. Those hospitals shouldn’t be on the hook to pay that $ back w/interest. I’m leading my NY colleagues in fighting to protect our hospitals & health workers by ensuring those payments are forgiven https://t.co/JUTCe0iEjU

In marking National Nurses Week it’s important that we care for our incredible nurses just as they care for us. I’ve joined @RepAOC @RepEspaillat @RepJoseSerrano & my N.Y. colleagues in demanding that the CDC revise outdated guidelines to protect nurses from COVID-19. @nynurses https://t.co/k9E03VbAkC

As we cont. to craft our phase 4 of #COVID19 response we are working to increase support for essential workers like janitors security officers & doormen. Phase 4 must include protections against layoffs more stimulus support and PPE for our essential workers. @32BJSEIU

Today is Nat’l #NursesDay a day to thank & honor the nurses fighting #COVID19 in NY and across the U.S. To all the incredible nurses standing on the front-lines in #NY16: we are eternally grateful to you. I’m cosponsoring a resolution marking 5/6–5/12 as Nat’l #NursesWeek. https://t.co/jFgGw8z8iO

Once again the Trump Administration is taking a premature victory lap by considering disbanding the coronavirus task force despite the fact that cases continue to increase in some parts of the country.  And nice of them to tell Dr. Fauci. https://t.co/LfdtPMfJD4

#DearBetsy #titleIX was put in place to protect student’s rights on campuses. Your alterations of the rule during this #covid19 pandemic would put students at risk rather than help them. It’s pretty shameful. https://t.co/lNoHSFpjJi

It's never been more clear that #HousingIsHealthcare. Emergency #rentalassistance will not only keep families stably housed but it will also help to curb the spread of #COVID19 & save lives. I’m supporting a bill to provide $100B in #rentalassistance

Six times the @StateDept was asked why the US wasn’t part of the international #Covid19 vaccine conference.   Now I’m making it seven—I want to know why too.   You can’t be a world leader when the US sits on the sidelines of the global response to the Coronavirus. https://t.co/60Kw5mLxFO

Thank you to my friends at @NYPortuguese for inviting me to speak at this morning’s virtual leadership meeting. As chair of @HouseForeign I will always work with great allies like Portugal to help get us through this global COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/BxexJiikWj

BREAKING: NY hospitals which have been on the frontlines of COVID-19 were just awarded $5 Billion in CARES Act funding.   @RepTomSuozzi @RepPeteKing & I sent a letter to @HHS demanding priority funding for NY and we got it!  Big win for our health care system & health workers. https://t.co/yUtypKeGgi

Schools need help and they need help now.   I led a group of New York Members to ensure New York State receives education funding in the next #COVID19 response package to prevent layoffs.    https://t.co/UTmDvgpeHV https://t.co/00CRcgRz3L

During this #COVID19 pandemic #NY16 is lucky to have #healthcareheroes like Angela Thomas and James Speights Jr who every day go above and beyond to help their fellow New Yorkers. Thank you for everything you do. @1199SEIU https://t.co/SaSS1hEdTq

On #workersmemorialday we honor those who were injured or lost their lives on the job. During this #Covid19 crisis we must do everything we can to keep the frontline workers safe. Thank you to our #NY16 unions for fighting so hard to make that happen. @WestPutAFLCIO https://t.co/NYjRWSvdjX

This #WorldImmunizationWeek I stand with the first responders & health care workers on the frontlines of #COVID19. To promote good health I helped introduced the VACCINES Act which supports #VaccinesForAll. Vaccines are and have always been both safe and critically important.

As we battle COVID19 asthma remains a particularly dangerous threat. As co-chair of the Asthma&Allergy Caucus I led a bipartisan letter w/ over 57 of my colleagues urging the FDA to take proactive actions to ensure that we have enough inhalers for the 25million living w/ asthma https://t.co/suxoGIFip0

This #EarthDay as Co-Chair of the Asthma & Allergy Caucus I joined @repbobbyrush on a letter to @EPAconcerning our air quality which is especially problematic in minority & low-income communities. In dealing w/#COVID19 we must cont. fighting for the health of our ppl & planet. https://t.co/mEQJMTsZUZ

Nursing home residents are highly susceptible to contracting #coronavirus. This omission is unacceptable and can allow bad actors to escape accountability. Americans deserve to know that their loved ones in nursing homes are receiving high-quality safe care during this crisis.

Last week I joined @HouseDemocrats in calling on @POTUS to require nursing homes to publicly report #COVID19 cases. Today the Trump Administration instituted a policy partially implementing it but left out key requirements which require the disclosure of #COVID19 fatalities. https://t.co/gJ0dtKo7Uv

This is classic @RealDonaldTrump. Seeking to claim credit for the #COVID19 checks by ordering his name signed where the memo should be. This vanity act nearly upended the process and for what? @POTUS needs to stop playing these shameful games with people’s lives. #stimuluscheck https://t.co/6qWAJIuGfJ

As Americans battle for their lives with coronavirus the last thing they should be thinking about is how they’ll pay for their care. Maybe this is the flashpoint we need to finally move toward #MedicareForAll. https://t.co/N8TQIhrWcN

I’ve been communicating w/the Postmaster General’s office for several weeks on a #Coronavirus delivery plan and I’m encouraging colleagues to take up P.O. financial support ASAP.   Don't forget: medicine ballots checks—the P.O. handles all these vital items. #SaveThePostOffice

To all those reaching out today saying Support the #USPS: I hear you loud and clear.   I have already been working with my Dem colleagues to find funding & delivery solutions during the #COVID19 pandemic.   The post office is critical. #SaveUSPS #SaveThePostOffice (1/2) https://t.co/1XkjCgs6Hz

Just when early reports indicate that initiatives like #SocialDistancing are working to help slow #COVID_19 the Trump Administration begins pulling the plug on vital federal resources.   We need to do more testing not less. https://t.co/duKuMwZaDc

Last week I led the #NewYork House Delegation in urging the Trump Administration to prioritize funding for NY health centers. These organizations are on the front-lines providing care to minority and underserved communities which are most affected by #COVID_19. https://t.co/DW7zsLWoBu

Community Health Centers in New York are on the frontlines of the #coronavirus pandemic.   The #CARES Act allocated $1.3 billion for these centers.  I led a bipartisan NY delegation letter to the Admin. calling for that funding to be prioritized for NY. https://t.co/rJaBKU0bst
The new field hospital being built in #VanCortlandtPark will have 200 beds and accept #Covid19 patients when it’s fully operational which should be in 3 weeks. https://t.co/9S21uZ0dxY

On Wed. @jeffreydinowitz @andrewcohenNYC @SenatorBiaggi & I sent a letter to the Postmaster General asking what the protocols are to deal with PO under-staffing & closures in 10463 due to #COVID19. We know they’re having difficulty but the community cannot be left in the dark.

There are reports of profiteers diverting #PPE supplies to the highest bidder overseas & away from our physicians nurses and first responders who are risking their lives to treat Americans.  I wrote to @VP calling on the Administration to restrict the export of #PPE. #COVID19 https://t.co/ewK0sUWuCw

Every #WorldAutismAwarenessDay we recognize the strength and diversity of the #Autism community. This year we must work to ensure that those living with Autism have access to the critical resources & services needed to fight the #COVID19Pandemic. #AutismAcceptanceMonth

An #EqualPayDay PSA: #COVID19 has made it clearer than ever that low-wage workers – ⅔ of which are women – are always essential. It’s time for Congress to recognize the value & dignity in all work by raising the minimum wage & passing #paidleaveforall. https://t.co/PXMidgFc8H

Starting tomorrow there will be a new #coronavirus mobile testing site in #CoopCity.   Northeast Bronx residents should call 888-364-3065 to get tested there—no walk-ins will be allowed and all patients must be in their vehicles.
My statement on today's House passage of the Senate #coronavirus aid and stimulus bill: https://t.co/84LwDnYFYo

We're sending out e-newsletter updates on #coronavirus  #COVID19 regularly right now. Yesterday's email focussed on my priorities for the Phase 3 package. Don't forget to sign-up to receive them in your inbox. https://t.co/vCuTgzLuJf
Put the American people first not big corporations.    Here’s what I want in the #coronavirus #COVID19 phase 3 aid package: https://t.co/DhM111kbmu

I stand with @32BJSEIU and contracted airport workers who on the front lines of #COVIDー19 keep our airports running. Airlines are laying off thousands of workers during this crisis. Any bailout or funding must #ProtectAllWorkers #AirlinesLaidMeOff #PovertyDoesntFly https://t.co/zZXiUAPt9R

Last week I joined my colleagues in a letter urging the inclusion of provisions to address the #mentalhealth dimensions of the #coronavirus crisis. I am hopeful Phase 3 will include funding for urgently needed mental health services--suicide prevention addiction treatment etc.

Let’s be clear: Any phase 3 #COVID19 package that doesn’t put the American people first is a non-starter in the House.   It’s amazing to me that even during a global pandemic the GOP’s first thought is “how can we bailout big corporations?”     Bailout the workers not CEOs.

Today the President signed into law the @HouseDemocrats’ Families First Coronavirus Response Act which provides paid leave and supports strong unemployment benefits for employees. #ProtectALLWorkers #COVID19 #coronavirus https://t.co/IsEFBvdGpW

In addition I will soon join my majority colleagues in cosponsoring legislation that would provide working and middle-class American families with at least $1000 to help prepare and respond to the economic consequences of #COVID19. More on that to come.

Joined colleagues in a letter to Fannie Mae Freddie Mac the Federal Housing Administration (FHA) and the Veterans Administration (VA) urging them to suspend foreclosure and eviction proceedings for the duration of the #coronavirus crisis.

Joined colleagues in a letter to @POTUS urging him to issue a mandate to allow federal employees to telework during COVID-19 crisis. I have already closed my offices in Washington and #NY16 and have asked my staff to telework from home.

Cosponsored the COVID-19 Worker Protection Act which would require the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) to ensure health care facilities implement infectious disease protocols to keep front line health care workers such as nurses safe.

Joined colleagues in a letter encouraging @POTUS to leverage the nation’s significant military assets to help combat the #coronavirus. This includes sending the Army Corp of Engineers to affected states like New York to help expeditiously build hospital capacity.
There’s been a lot of activity in Washington to combat #coronavirus and protect Americans during these difficult times. Here’s what I’ve been working on and signing onto during this crisis:

Recently @EnergyCommerce Health sub. passed my bill to protect Americans from fake medical products including fake #COVID19 tests.   It’s critical that the next phase of leg. have measures to protect ppl from criminals selling fake #coronavirus products. https://t.co/h0lE70sNKd

Yesterday I joined my House colleagues on calling on the President to leverage military assets to combat the outbreak of #COVID19 including sending the Army Corp of Engineers to help build critical hospital capacity. https://t.co/d3dXOecLbY
Important during the #CoronavirusOutbreak for the #MountVernonHospital to remain fully staffed and operational. https://t.co/rrXaHPfkHc

Following guidance from health officials I have decided to close my Washington and #NY16 offices. My staff have been instructed to telework from home until further notice due to the coronavirus outbreak. We remain committed to our constituents and have provided more info below. https://t.co/w8bMYCIzez

The #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act which we passed Friday guarantees free testing. If you have questions about testing please call the NY Department if Health Coronavirus #COVID19 hotline at 1-888-364-3065.

With #StPatricksDay this week folks need to be reminded of the need for #socialdistancing and how we must avoid gathering in large crowds — which are pathways to spreading the #coronavirus. Please remember those most at risk: seniors and ppl with preexisting health conditions.

Our latest community update on #coronavirus including information on last night's legislation testing in #NewRochelle and our work to extend the #2020census in light of the situation: https://t.co/8B6yRpoEjq
They deserve not just our thanks but our support and deepest appreciation.   We need to protect workers on the front-lines of the #coronavirus/#Covid_19 fight. https://t.co/balVJxMccB

I fully support @SpeakerPelosi’s efforts to provide American families with the help they need without further delay. I hope congressional Republicans will stop their posturing and do their jobs so we can all get back home and help address #coronavirus in our communities. https://t.co/8jFmPu0PWt

Today the New York State Department of Health will be holding a webinar for health care providers responding to the COVID-19 outbreak in our district and the state at 1pm.   Details: https://t.co/vi5BsIVMKf

Just got off the phone w/ #NewRochelle Mayor @NoamBramson. We are coordinating at all levels of gov't —local state federal—to contain #coronavirus. I commend Mayor Bramson @RyeGSL & @NYGovCuomo for their steady leadership. I will cont. pushing for additional federal resources.

Workers should not have to choose between their paychecks and their health.   Today I helped introduce a bill that would give workers 14 days of paid sick leave if a public health emergency like #coronavirus/COVID-19 is declared. https://t.co/C44ab74IaT
New Yorkers: The @HealthNYGov #coronavirus hotline is now live at 1-888-364-3065. A 24/7 service that offers information and help with combatting the spread of Coronavirus.

With the first reported case of #coronavirus (#COVID19) in NY it’s critical that our gov’t take all steps to ensure our hospitals and doctors have the resources to treat Americans.   Later this week I’ll be joining @RepScottPeters to intro legislation addressing drug shortages. https://t.co/OU4hBzFaTD

As we saw last night President Trump is leading a chaotic response to #coronavirus. We need a well-coordinated whole-of-government response. I’m introducing a bill to create an emergency response coordinator position who will coordinate the federal government’s efforts.

After slashing CDC’s budget President Trump has the gall to send Congress a meager proposal to combat the #Coronavirus. I commend @SenSchumer for putting together a proposal that will protect Americans. @HouseForeign & @EnergyCommerce are working hand-in-hand to fight the disease

The US should be stepping up not retreating from the world on #Coronavirus. We need close coordination with global partners & adequate resources for local national & multilateral public health organizations yet the Trump Admin continues to propose deep cuts for the #CDC & #WHO https://t.co/cx4qmkC2Jz

Coronavirus now known as COVID-19 is spreading across the globe at an alarming rate including 13 cases in the US. To help prepare I moderated a briefing with federal health officials including Dr. Tony Fauci and Members of Congress about our prevention and response strategy. https://t.co/HOn2MFWiwI
